10/10 game with a very original concept and amazing execution. The way the story unfolds is also very well thought through. All in all I definitely recommend playing this classic.
Easily among the best video games of all time. They don't make them like they used to.

[h1] Game Details [/h1]
[list]
	[*]   [b] Game Name: [/b] Portal
	[*]   [b] Game Release: [/b] 2007
	[*]   [b] Genre Tags: [/b] Puzzle, Story Rich, Atmospheric, Platformer, Singleplayer
	[*]   [b] Estimated Playtime: [/b] 2-5+ Hours
	[*]   [b] Personal Rating: [/b] 8/10
[/list]

[h1] Review [/h1]
[b] Summary - [/b] Portal is a series of first-person puzzle-platform video games developed by Valve. Set in the Half-Life universe, the two main games in the series, Portal (2007) and Portal 2 (2011), center on a woman, Chell, forced to undergo a series of tests within the Aperture Science Enrichment Center by a malicious artificial intelligence, GLaDOS, that controls the facility. As a subject to GLaDOS, your main goal is to escape from this facility and find freedom through the maze of puzzles GLaDOS forces you to do.

[b] Story - [/b] Portal has a really unique and fascinating story. In the beginning it thought it was just gonna be a simple puzzle game that you have to go through some puzzles and that‚Äôs about it, but the further you get into the levels, the more strange GLaDOS becomes. It was really fun and kept me interested throughout the experience. The further you get into it, the darker and atmospheric it gets. The atmosphere is incredible and you can piece together what happened in the facility just by the environmental storytelling. Valve did an awesome job with this game and I can see why it is so popular, even today! 

[b] Gameplay - [/b] Portal has a truly unique take on gameplay (I keep saying unique apparently). You basically have a tool called the ‚ÄúAperture Science Handheld Portal Device‚Äù. With this tool, you can make these portals and can go anywhere you want on the map (or course). You can use this tool to get you forward momentum to go super fast, or use it to ambush some turrets. It‚Äôs a basic mechanic that gives you a lot of freedom. I will say the majority of the puzzles were pretty easy unfortunately. I will say that the later stage of the game gets a little more interesting in terms of difficulty which was the best part of the game. If you are looking for really hard puzzles, it‚Äôs not here in my opinion. The antagonist GLaDOS has some dark humor and I absolutely loved it! 

[b] Graphics - [/b] The Valve engine is timeless. With a lab/facility environment, I have no complaints at all! I had no stutters, no lock ups, no frame drops, it was super smooth. The atmosphere was incredible as well and they nailed it right out of the part. The lighting is really smooth and flows really well with the environments, even for a game that was made 15 years ago! The graphics are just spectacular and I have zero issues on this section.

[h1] Pros: [/h1]
[list]
	[*] Fun mechanics
	[*] Unique Story
	[*] Loved the dark humor
	[*] Game aged really well
	[*] Amazing environmental storytelling
	[*] Simple but effective story
[/list]

[h1] Cons: [/h1]
[list]
	[*] Puzzles were easier than I expected
	[*] Wish the story was a little longer
[/list]

Even though I'm not a big puzzle game person, and the puzzles can be frustrating for me, I still enjoyed the concept and the gameplay through the main stages. Thanks to a friend watching me play this, it helped a bit while he did so. I'm definitely am going to get the rest of the achievements, play through the challenges, and play the 2nd game when I get the chance.
100% recomendable si es tu primera vez con steam

By order of Aperture Sciences, I am required to tell you that this game cannot be the death of you several times over. Additionally, I must inform you that this game may or may not take over your life and create an addiction to jumping through portals that may or may not cause irreparable harm.

just yes this game is always amazing even if i have not touched it much in years still one of the games i remember so fondly and still honestly amazing.
One of my favorite puzzle games.  Great plot.  Does nauseate me after about 45 min of play.
Truly a classic, there's no other game quite like it. One of my favorite games in terms of nostalgia and in terms of brainpower needed.
